summary: Diff implements global dark theme application via adding the `dark` class on the root element and expanding global CSS variables/styles, plus adds/adjusts Task Drawer, Task Page, and Quill editor theming for visibility. However, some requested UI-only scope constraints appear to be exceeded (unrelated UI redesigns and hook changes referenced in summaries), and Task Page scrolling behavior cannot be fully verified from the truncated diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Scrolling within the Task Page works and content is not clipped by overflow/z-index issues.
missing_requirements.reason: The Task Page root container is set to `overflow-hidden` (`<main className="... overflow-hidden">`). The diff is truncated before showing any internal scroll container, so it is not verifiable that scrolling is enabled for the editor/content area and not clipped.

hallucinated_features.description: Service worker registration changes/logging in App component.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest is a UI/CSS visibility regression fix only and explicitly says to keep backend unchanged; service worker registration is not mentioned as part of the required CSS/theme fixes.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend-operation React Query hook expansions (e.g., new useGetTask/useUpdateTaskContent) referenced as modified.
hallucinated_features.reason: Non-goals include adding new task features or changing task data models/APIs; the diff summary text claims hook changes to support full-page editor persistence, which goes beyond a pure UI/CSS visibility regression fix request.

hallucinated_features.description: Redesign of Login screen and Profile setup modal for brighter/white text and improved contrast.
hallucinated_features.reason: Non-goals include redesigning unrelated screens beyond what is necessary to restore visibility/contrast for the drawer and task page; login/profile screens are not part of REQ-9/10/11 scope.
